subject: Photography
title: Leading Lines
description: A quick win: understand Leading Lines.

hook.text: Roads, rivers, fences, shadows â€” lines in your scene guide the viewer's eye exactly where you want it to go.

buildup.text: Leading lines are visual paths that direct attention through the frame toward the main subject.

discovery.text: Lines converging toward a vanishing point create powerful depth. A road disappearing into distance pulls the eye in.

twist.text: Lines don't have to be straight. A winding river, a curved staircase, a spiral â€” all guide the eye differently.

climax.text: The best leading lines feel natural, not forced. They were always in the scene â€” you just noticed them.

punchline.text: Find the lines. Follow them. Let your viewer follow too.

quiz.question: What do leading lines do in a photograph?
options: Guide the viewer's eye through the frame toward the subject
